00051 /* This is slightly more than the number of records that can fit into a
00052  * single llog file, because the llog_log_header takes up some of the
00053  * space in the first block that cannot be used for the bitmap. */
00054 #define LLOG_TEST_RECNUM  (LLOG_MIN_CHUNK_SIZE * 8)
00055 
00056 static int llog_test_rand;
00057 static struct obd_uuid uuid = { .uuid = "test_uuid" };
00058 static struct llog_logid cat_logid;
00059 
00060 struct llog_mini_rec {
00061         struct llog_rec_hdr     lmr_hdr;
00062         struct llog_rec_tail    lmr_tail;
00063 } __attribute__((packed));
00064 
00065 static int verify_handle(char *test, struct llog_handle *llh, int num_recs)
00066 {
00067         int i;
00068         int last_idx = 0;
00069         int active_recs = 0;
00070 
00071         for (i = 0; i < LLOG_HDR_BITMAP_SIZE(llh->lgh_hdr); i++) {
00072                 if (ext2_test_bit(i, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh->lgh_hdr))) {
00073                         last_idx = i;
00074                         active_recs++;
00075                 }
00076         }
00077 
00078         /* check the llog is sane at first, llh_count and lgh_last_idx*/
00079         if (llh->lgh_hdr->llh_count != active_recs) {
00080                 CERROR("%s: handle->count is %d, but there are %d recs found\n",
00081                        test, llh->lgh_hdr->llh_count, active_recs);
00082                 RETURN(-ERANGE);
00083         }
00084 
00085         if (llh->lgh_last_idx != LLOG_HDR_TAIL(llh->lgh_hdr)->lrt_index ||
00086             (!(llh->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT) &&
00087              llh->lgh_last_idx < last_idx)) {
00088                 CERROR("%s: lgh_last_idx is %d (%d in the header), last found %d\n",
00089                        test, llh->lgh_last_idx,
00090                        LLOG_HDR_TAIL(llh->lgh_hdr)->lrt_index, last_idx);
00091                 RETURN(-ERANGE);
00092         }
00093 
00094         /* finally checks against expected value from the caller */
00095         if (active_recs != num_recs) {
00096                 CERROR("%s: expected %d active recs after write, found %d\n",
00097                        test, num_recs, active_recs);
00098                 RETURN(-ERANGE);
00099         }
00100 
00101         RETURN(0);
00102 }

00104 /* Test named-log create/open, close */
00105 static int llog_test_1(const struct lu_env *env,
00106                        struct obd_device *obd, char *name)
00107 {
00108         struct llog_handle      *llh;
00109         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00110         int rc;
00111         int rc2;
00112 
00113         ENTRY;
00114 
00115         CWARN("1a: create a log with name: %s\n", name);
00116         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT);
00117         LASSERT(ctxt);
00118 
00119         rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, &llh, NULL, name);
00120         if (rc) {
00121                 CERROR("1a: llog_create with name %s failed: %d\n", name, rc);
00122                 GOTO(out, rc);
00123         }
00124         rc = llog_init_handle(env, llh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, &uuid);
00125         if (rc) {
00126                 CERROR("1a: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
00127                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00128         }
00129 
00130         rc = verify_handle("1", llh, 1);
00131 
00132         CWARN("1b: close newly-created log\n");
00133 out_close:
00134         rc2 = llog_close(env, llh);
00135         if (rc2) {
00136                 CERROR("1b: close log %s failed: %d\n", name, rc2);
00137                 if (rc == 0)
00138                         rc = rc2;
00139         }
00140 out:
00141         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00142         RETURN(rc);
00143 }

00145 static int test_2_cancel_cb(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
00146                             struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
00147 {
00148         return LLOG_DEL_RECORD;
00149 }

00151 /* Test named-log reopen; returns opened log on success */
00152 static int llog_test_2(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd,
00153                        char *name, struct llog_handle **llh)
00154 {
00155         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00156         struct llog_handle      *lgh;
00157         struct llog_logid        logid;
00158         int                      rc;
00159         struct llog_mini_rec     lmr;
00160 
00161         ENTRY;
00162 
00163         CWARN("2a: re-open a log with name: %s\n", name);
00164         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT);
00165         LASSERT(ctxt);
00166 
00167         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, llh, NULL, name, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
00168         if (rc) {
00169                 CERROR("2a: re-open log with name %s failed: %d\n", name, rc);
00170                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
00171         }
00172 
00173         rc = llog_init_handle(env, *llh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, &uuid);
00174         if (rc) {
00175                 CERROR("2a: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
00176                 GOTO(out_close_llh, rc);
00177         }
00178 
00179         rc = verify_handle("2", *llh, 1);
00180         if (rc)
00181                 GOTO(out_close_llh, rc);
00182 
00183         CWARN("2b: create a log without specified NAME & LOGID\n");
00184         rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, &lgh, NULL, NULL);
00185         if (rc) {
00186                 CERROR("2b: create log failed\n");
00187                 GOTO(out_close_llh, rc);
00188         }
00189         rc = llog_init_handle(env, lgh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, &uuid);
00190         if (rc) {
00191                 CERROR("2b: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
00192                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00193         }
00194 
00195         logid = lgh->lgh_id;
00196 
00197         lmr.lmr_hdr.lrh_len = lmr.lmr_tail.lrt_len = LLOG_MIN_REC_SIZE;
00198         lmr.lmr_hdr.lrh_type = 0xf02f02;
00199 
00200         /* Check llog header values are correct after record add/cancel */
00201         CWARN("2b: write 1 llog records, check llh_count\n");
00202         rc = llog_write(env, lgh, &lmr.lmr_hdr, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
00203         if (rc < 0)
00204                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00205 
00206         /* in-memory values after record addition */
00207         rc = verify_handle("2b", lgh, 2);
00208         if (rc < 0)
00209                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00210 
00211         /* re-open llog to read on-disk values */
00212         llog_close(env, lgh);
00213 
00214         CWARN("2c: re-open the log by LOGID and verify llh_count\n");
00215         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &lgh, &logid, NULL, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
00216         if (rc < 0) {
00217                 CERROR("2c: re-open log by LOGID failed\n");
00218                 GOTO(out_close_llh, rc);
00219         }
00220 
00221         rc = llog_init_handle(env, lgh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, &uuid);
00222         if (rc < 0) {
00223                 CERROR("2c: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
00224                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00225         }
00226 
00227         /* check values just read from disk */
00228         rc = verify_handle("2c", lgh, 2);
00229         if (rc < 0)
00230                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00231 
00232         rc = llog_process(env, lgh, test_2_cancel_cb, NULL, NULL);
00233         if (rc < 0)
00234                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00235 
00236         /* in-memory values */
00237         rc = verify_handle("2c", lgh, 1);
00238         if (rc < 0)
00239                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00240 
00241         /* re-open llog to get on-disk values */
00242         llog_close(env, lgh);
00243 
00244         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &lgh, &logid, NULL, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
00245         if (rc) {
00246                 CERROR("2c: re-open log by LOGID failed\n");
00247                 GOTO(out_close_llh, rc);
00248         }
00249 
00250         rc = llog_init_handle(env, lgh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, &uuid);
00251         if (rc) {
00252                 CERROR("2c: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
00253                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00254         }
00255 
00256         /* on-disk values after llog re-open */
00257         rc = verify_handle("2c", lgh, 1);
00258         if (rc < 0)
00259                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00260 
00261         CWARN("2d: destroy this log\n");
00262         rc = llog_destroy(env, lgh);
00263         if (rc)
00264                 CERROR("2d: destroy log failed\n");
00265 out_close:
00266         llog_close(env, lgh);
00267 out_close_llh:
00268         if (rc)
00269                 llog_close(env, *llh);
00270 out_put:
00271         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00272 
00273         RETURN(rc);
00274 }
00275 
00276 static int test_3_rec_num;
00277 static off_t test_3_rec_off;
00278 static int test_3_paddings;
00279 static int test_3_start_idx;
00280 
00281 /*
00282  * Test 3 callback.
00283  * - check lgh_cur_offset correctness
00284  * - check record index consistency
00285  * - modify each record in-place
00286  * - add new record during *last_idx processing
00287  */
00288 static int test3_check_n_add_cb(const struct lu_env *env,
00289                                 struct llog_handle *lgh,
00290                                 struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
00291 {
00292         struct llog_gen_rec *lgr = (struct llog_gen_rec *)rec;
00293         int *last_rec = data;
00294         unsigned cur_idx = test_3_start_idx + test_3_rec_num;
00295         int rc;
00296 
00297         if (lgh->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_FIXSIZE) {
00298                 LASSERT(lgh->lgh_hdr->llh_size > 0);
00299                 if (lgh->lgh_cur_offset != lgh->lgh_hdr->llh_hdr.lrh_len +
00300                                         (cur_idx - 1) * lgh->lgh_hdr->llh_size)
00301                         CERROR("Wrong record offset in cur_off: "LPU64", should be %u\n",
00302                                lgh->lgh_cur_offset,
00303                                lgh->lgh_hdr->llh_hdr.lrh_len +
00304                                (cur_idx - 1) * lgh->lgh_hdr->llh_size);
00305         } else {
00306                 size_t chunk_size = lgh->lgh_hdr->llh_hdr.lrh_len;
00307 
00308                 /* For variable size records the start offset is unknown, trust
00309                  * the first value and check others are consistent with it. */
00310                 if (test_3_rec_off == 0)
00311                         test_3_rec_off = lgh->lgh_cur_offset;
00312 
00313                 if (lgh->lgh_cur_offset != test_3_rec_off) {
00314                         __u64 tmp = lgh->lgh_cur_offset;
00315 
00316                         /* there can be padding record */
00317                         if ((do_div(tmp, chunk_size) == 0) &&
00318                             (lgh->lgh_cur_offset - test_3_rec_off <
00319                              rec->lrh_len + LLOG_MIN_REC_SIZE)) {
00320                                 test_3_rec_off = lgh->lgh_cur_offset;
00321                                 test_3_paddings++;
00322                         } else {
00323                                 CERROR("Wrong record offset in cur_off: "LPU64
00324                                        ", should be %lld (rec len %u)\n",
00325                                        lgh->lgh_cur_offset,
00326                                        (long long)test_3_rec_off,
00327                                        rec->lrh_len);
00328                         }
00329                 }
00330                 test_3_rec_off += rec->lrh_len;
00331         }
00332 
00333         cur_idx += test_3_paddings;
00334         if (cur_idx != rec->lrh_index)
00335                 CERROR("Record with wrong index was read: %u, expected %u\n",
00336                        rec->lrh_index, cur_idx);
00337 
00338         /* modify all records in place */
00339         lgr->lgr_gen.conn_cnt = rec->lrh_index;
00340         rc = llog_write(env, lgh, rec, rec->lrh_index);
00341         if (rc < 0)
00342                 CERROR("cb_test_3: cannot modify record while processing\n");
00343 
00344         /* Add new record to the llog at *last_rec position one by one to
00345          * check that last block is re-read during processing */
00346         if (cur_idx == *last_rec || cur_idx == (*last_rec + 1)) {
00347                 rc = llog_write(env, lgh, rec, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
00348                 if (rc < 0)
00349                         CERROR("cb_test_3: cannot add new record while "
00350                                "processing\n");
00351         }
00352         test_3_rec_num++;
00353 
00354         return rc;
00355 }
00356 
00357 /* Check in-place modifications were done for all records*/
00358 static int test3_check_cb(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *lgh,
00359                           struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
00360 {
00361         struct llog_gen_rec *lgr = (struct llog_gen_rec *)rec;
00362 
00363         if (lgr->lgr_gen.conn_cnt != rec->lrh_index) {
00364                 CERROR("cb_test_3: record %u is not modified\n",
00365                        rec->lrh_index);
00366                 return -EINVAL;
00367         }
00368         test_3_rec_num++;
00369         return 0;
00370 }
00371 
00372 static int llog_test3_process(const struct lu_env *env,
00373                               struct llog_handle *lgh,
00374                               llog_cb_t cb, int start)
00375 {
00376         struct llog_process_cat_data cd;
00377         int last_idx; /* new record will be injected here */
00378         int rc = 0;
00379 
00380         CWARN("test3: processing records from index %d to the end\n",
00381               start);
00382         cd.lpcd_first_idx = start - 1;
00383         cd.lpcd_last_idx = 0;
00384         test_3_rec_num = test_3_paddings = 0;
00385         last_idx = lgh->lgh_last_idx;
00386         rc = llog_process(env, lgh, cb, &last_idx, &cd);
00387         if (rc < 0)
00388                 return rc;
00389         CWARN("test3: total %u records processed with %u paddings\n",
00390               test_3_rec_num, test_3_paddings);
00391         return test_3_rec_num;
00392 }
00393 
00394 /* Test plain llog functionality */
00395 static int llog_test_3(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd,
00396                        struct llog_handle *llh)
00397 {
00398         char buf[128];
00399         struct llog_rec_hdr *hdr = (void *)buf;
00400         int rc, i;
00401         int num_recs = 1; /* 1 for the header */
00402         int expected;
00403 
00404         ENTRY;
00405 
00406         hdr->lrh_len = sizeof(struct llog_gen_rec);
00407         hdr->lrh_type = LLOG_GEN_REC;
00408         llh->lgh_hdr->llh_size = sizeof(struct llog_gen_rec);
00409         llh->lgh_hdr->llh_flags |= LLOG_F_IS_FIXSIZE;
00410 
00411         /* Fill the llog with 64-bytes records, use 1023 records,
00412          * so last chunk will be partially full. Don't change this
00413          * value until record size is changed.
00414          */
00415         CWARN("3a: write 1023 fixed-size llog records\n");
00416         for (i = 0; i < 1023; i++) {
00417                 rc = llog_write(env, llh, hdr, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
00418                 if (rc < 0) {
00419                         CERROR("3a: write 1023 records failed at #%d: %d\n",
00420                                i + 1, rc);
00421                         RETURN(rc);
00422                 }
00423                 num_recs++;
00424         }
00425 
00426         rc = verify_handle("3a", llh, num_recs);
00427         if (rc)
00428                 RETURN(rc);
00429 
00430         /*
00431          * Test fixed-size records processing:
00432          * - search the needed index
00433          * - go through all records from that index
00434          * - check all indices are growing monotonically and exist
00435          * - modify each record
00436          *
00437          * NB: test3_check_n_add adds two new records while processing
00438          * after last record. There were 1023 records created so the last chunk
00439          * misses exactly one record. Therefore one of new records will be
00440          * the last in the current chunk and second causes the new chunk to be
00441          * created.
00442          */
00443         test_3_rec_off = 0;
00444         test_3_start_idx = 501;
00445         expected = 525;
00446         rc = llog_test3_process(env, llh, test3_check_n_add_cb,
00447                                 test_3_start_idx);
00448         if (rc < 0)
00449                 RETURN(rc);
00450 
00451         /* extra record is created during llog_process() */
00452         if (rc != expected) {
00453                 CERROR("3a: process total %d records but expect %d\n",
00454                        rc, expected);
00455                 RETURN(-ERANGE);
00456         }
00457 
00458         num_recs += 2;
00459 
00460         /* test modification in place */
00461         rc = llog_test3_process(env, llh, test3_check_cb, test_3_start_idx);
00462         if (rc < 0)
00463                 RETURN(rc);
00464 
00465         if (rc != expected) {
00466                 CERROR("3a: process total %d records but expect %d\n",
00467                        rc, expected);
00468                 RETURN(-ERANGE);
00469         }
00470 
00471         CWARN("3b: write 566 variable size llog records\n");
00472 
00473         /* Drop llh_size to 0 to mark llog as variable-size and write
00474          * header to make this change permanent. */
00475         llh->lgh_hdr->llh_flags &= ~LLOG_F_IS_FIXSIZE;
00476         llog_write(env, llh, &llh->lgh_hdr->llh_hdr, LLOG_HEADER_IDX);
00477 
00478         hdr->lrh_type = OBD_CFG_REC;
00479 
00480         /* there are 1025 64-bytes records in llog already,
00481          * the last chunk contains single record, i.e. 64 bytes.
00482          * Each pair of variable size records is 200 bytes, so
00483          * we will have the following distribution per chunks:
00484          * block 1: 64 + 80(80/120) + 80 + 48(pad) = 81 iterations
00485          * block 2: 80(120/80) + 120 + 72(pad) = 81 itereations
00486          * block 3: 80(80/120) + 80 + 112(pad) = 81 iterations
00487          * -- the same as block 2 again and so on.
00488          * block 7: 80(80/120) = 80 iterations and 192 bytes remain
00489          * Total 6 * 81 + 80 = 566 itereations.
00490          * Callback will add another 120 bytes in the end of the last chunk
00491          * and another 120 bytes will cause padding (72 bytes) plus 120
00492          * bytes in the new block.
00493          */
00494         for (i = 0; i < 566; i++) {
00495                 if ((i % 2) == 0)
00496                         hdr->lrh_len = 80;
00497                 else
00498                         hdr->lrh_len = 120;
00499 
00500                 rc = llog_write(env, llh, hdr, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
00501                 if (rc < 0) {
00502                         CERROR("3b: write 566 records failed at #%d: %d\n",
00503                                i + 1, rc);
00504                         RETURN(rc);
00505                 }
00506                 num_recs++;
00507         }
00508 
00509         rc = verify_handle("3b", llh, num_recs);
00510         if (rc)
00511                 RETURN(rc);
00512 
00513         test_3_start_idx = 1026;
00514         expected = 568;
00515         rc = llog_test3_process(env, llh, test3_check_n_add_cb,
00516                                 test_3_start_idx);
00517         if (rc < 0)
00518                 RETURN(rc);
00519 
00520         if (rc != expected) {
00521                 CERROR("3b: process total %d records but expect %d\n",
00522                        rc, expected);
00523                 RETURN(-ERANGE);
00524         }
00525 
00526         num_recs += 2;
00527 
00528         /* test modification in place */
00529         rc = llog_test3_process(env, llh, test3_check_cb, test_3_start_idx);
00530         if (rc < 0)
00531                 RETURN(rc);
00532 
00533         if (rc != expected) {
00534                 CERROR("3b: process total %d records but expect %d\n",
00535                        rc, expected);
00536                 RETURN(-ERANGE);
00537         }
00538 
00539         CWARN("3c: write records with variable size until BITMAP_SIZE, "
00540               "return -ENOSPC\n");
00541         while (num_recs < LLOG_HDR_BITMAP_SIZE(llh->lgh_hdr)) {
00542                 if ((num_recs % 2) == 0)
00543                         hdr->lrh_len = 80;
00544                 else
00545                         hdr->lrh_len = 128;
00546 
00547                 rc = llog_write(env, llh, hdr, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
00548                 if (rc == -ENOSPC) {
00549                         break;
00550                 } else if (rc < 0) {
00551                         CERROR("3c: write recs failed at #%d: %d\n",
00552                                num_recs, rc);
00553                         RETURN(rc);
00554                 }
00555                 num_recs++;
00556         }
00557 
00558         if (rc != -ENOSPC) {
00559                 CWARN("3c: write record more than BITMAP size!\n");
00560                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00561         }
00562         CWARN("3c: wrote %d more records before end of llog is reached\n",
00563               num_recs);
00564 
00565         rc = verify_handle("3c", llh, num_recs);
00566 
00567         RETURN(rc);
00568 }
00569 
00570 /* Test catalogue additions */
00571 static int llog_test_4(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd)
00572 {
00573         struct llog_handle      *cath;
00574         char                     name[10];
00575         int                      rc, rc2, i, buflen;
00576         struct llog_mini_rec     lmr;
00577         struct llog_cookie       cookie;
00578         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00579         int                      num_recs = 0;
00580         char                    *buf;
00581         struct llog_rec_hdr     *rec;
00582 
00583         ENTRY;
00584 
00585         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT);
00586         LASSERT(ctxt);
00587 
00588         lmr.lmr_hdr.lrh_len = lmr.lmr_tail.lrt_len = LLOG_MIN_REC_SIZE;
00589         lmr.lmr_hdr.lrh_type = 0xf00f00;
00590 
00591         sprintf(name, "%x", llog_test_rand + 1);
00592         CWARN("4a: create a catalog log with name: %s\n", name);
00593         rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, &cath, NULL, name);
00594         if (rc) {
00595                 CERROR("4a: llog_create with name %s failed: %d\n", name, rc);
00596                 GOTO(ctxt_release, rc);
00597         }
00598         rc = llog_init_handle(env, cath, LLOG_F_IS_CAT, &uuid);
00599         if (rc) {
00600                 CERROR("4a: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
00601                 GOTO(out, rc);
00602         }
00603 
00604         num_recs++;
00605         cat_logid = cath->lgh_id;
00606 
00607         CWARN("4b: write 1 record into the catalog\n");
00608         rc = llog_cat_add(env, cath, &lmr.lmr_hdr, &cookie);
00609         if (rc != 1) {
00610                 CERROR("4b: write 1 catalog record failed at: %d\n", rc);
00611                 GOTO(out, rc);
00612         }
00613         num_recs++;
00614         rc = verify_handle("4b", cath, 2);
00615         if (rc)
00616                 GOTO(out, rc);
00617 
00618         rc = verify_handle("4b", cath->u.chd.chd_current_log, num_recs);
00619         if (rc)
00620                 GOTO(out, rc);
00621 
00622         CWARN("4c: cancel 1 log record\n");
00623         rc = llog_cat_cancel_records(env, cath, 1, &cookie);
00624         if (rc) {
00625                 CERROR("4c: cancel 1 catalog based record failed: %d\n", rc);
00626                 GOTO(out, rc);
00627         }
00628         num_recs--;
00629 
00630         rc = verify_handle("4c", cath->u.chd.chd_current_log, num_recs);
00631         if (rc)
00632                 GOTO(out, rc);
00633 
00634         CWARN("4d: write %d more log records\n", LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
00635         for (i = 0; i < LLOG_TEST_RECNUM; i++) {
00636                 rc = llog_cat_add(env, cath, &lmr.lmr_hdr, NULL);
00637                 if (rc) {
00638                         CERROR("4d: write %d records failed at #%d: %d\n",
00639                                LLOG_TEST_RECNUM, i + 1, rc);
00640                         GOTO(out, rc);
00641                 }
00642                 num_recs++;
00643         }
00644 
00645         /* make sure new plain llog appears */
00646         rc = verify_handle("4d", cath, 3);
00647         if (rc)
00648                 GOTO(out, rc);
00649 
00650         CWARN("4e: add 5 large records, one record per block\n");
00651         buflen = LLOG_MIN_CHUNK_SIZE;
00652         OBD_ALLOC(buf, buflen);
00653         if (buf == NULL)
00654                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00655         for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
00656                 rec = (void *)buf;
00657                 rec->lrh_len = buflen;
00658                 rec->lrh_type = OBD_CFG_REC;
00659                 rc = llog_cat_add(env, cath, rec, NULL);
00660                 if (rc) {
00661                         CERROR("4e: write 5 records failed at #%d: %d\n",
00662                                i + 1, rc);
00663                         GOTO(out_free, rc);
00664                 }
00665                 num_recs++;
00666         }
00667 out_free:
00668         OBD_FREE(buf, buflen);
00669 out:
00670         CWARN("4f: put newly-created catalog\n");
00671         rc2 = llog_cat_close(env, cath);
00672         if (rc2) {
00673                 CERROR("4: close log %s failed: %d\n", name, rc2);
00674                 if (rc == 0)
00675                         rc = rc2;
00676         }
00677 ctxt_release:
00678         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00679         RETURN(rc);
00680 }
00681 
00682 static int cat_counter;
00683 
00684 static int cat_print_cb(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
00685                         struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
00686 {
00687         struct llog_logid_rec   *lir = (struct llog_logid_rec *)rec;
00688         struct lu_fid            fid = {0};
00689 
00690         if (rec->lrh_type != LLOG_LOGID_MAGIC) {
00691                 CERROR("invalid record in catalog\n");
00692                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00693         }
00694 
00695         logid_to_fid(&lir->lid_id, &fid);
00696 
00697         CWARN("seeing record at index %d - "DFID" in log "DFID"\n",
00698               rec->lrh_index, PFID(&fid),
00699               PFID(lu_object_fid(&llh->lgh_obj->do_lu)));
00700 
00701         cat_counter++;
00702 
00703         RETURN(0);
00704 }
00705 
00706 static int plain_counter;
00707 
00708 static int plain_print_cb(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
00709                           struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
00710 {
00711         struct lu_fid fid = {0};
00712 
00713         if (!(llh->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN)) {
00714                 CERROR("log is not plain\n");
00715                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00716         }
00717 
00718         logid_to_fid(&llh->lgh_id, &fid);
00719 
00720         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "seeing record at index %d in log "DFID"\n",
00721                rec->lrh_index, PFID(&fid));
00722 
00723         plain_counter++;
00724 
00725         RETURN(0);
00726 }
00727 
00728 static int cancel_count;
00729 
00730 static int llog_cancel_rec_cb(const struct lu_env *env,
00731                               struct llog_handle *llh,
00732                               struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
00733 {
00734         struct llog_cookie cookie;
00735 
00736         if (!(llh->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN)) {
00737                 CERROR("log is not plain\n");
00738                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00739         }
00740 
00741         cookie.lgc_lgl = llh->lgh_id;
00742         cookie.lgc_index = rec->lrh_index;
00743 
00744         llog_cat_cancel_records(env, llh->u.phd.phd_cat_handle, 1, &cookie);
00745         cancel_count++;
00746         if (cancel_count == LLOG_TEST_RECNUM)
00747                 RETURN(-LLOG_EEMPTY);
00748         RETURN(0);
00749 }

00751 /* Test log and catalogue processing */
00752 static int llog_test_5(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd)
00753 {
00754         struct llog_handle      *llh = NULL;
00755         char                     name[10];
00756         int                      rc, rc2;
00757         struct llog_mini_rec     lmr;
00758         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00759 
00760         ENTRY;
00761 
00762         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT);
00763         LASSERT(ctxt);
00764 
00765         lmr.lmr_hdr.lrh_len = lmr.lmr_tail.lrt_len = LLOG_MIN_REC_SIZE;
00766         lmr.lmr_hdr.lrh_type = 0xf00f00;
00767 
00768         CWARN("5a: re-open catalog by id\n");
00769         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &llh, &cat_logid, NULL, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
00770         if (rc) {
00771                 CERROR("5a: llog_create with logid failed: %d\n", rc);
00772                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
00773         }
00774 
00775         rc = llog_init_handle(env, llh, LLOG_F_IS_CAT, &uuid);
00776         if (rc) {
00777                 CERROR("5a: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
00778                 GOTO(out, rc);
00779         }
00780 
00781         CWARN("5b: print the catalog entries.. we expect 2\n");
00782         cat_counter = 0;
00783         rc = llog_process(env, llh, cat_print_cb, "test 5", NULL);
00784         if (rc) {
00785                 CERROR("5b: process with cat_print_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
00786                 GOTO(out, rc);
00787         }
00788         if (cat_counter != 2) {
00789                 CERROR("5b: %d entries in catalog\n", cat_counter);
00790                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00791         }
00792 
00793         CWARN("5c: Cancel %d records, see one log zapped\n", LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
00794         cancel_count = 0;
00795         rc = llog_cat_process(env, llh, llog_cancel_rec_cb, "foobar", 0, 0);
00796         if (rc != -LLOG_EEMPTY) {
00797                 CERROR("5c: process with llog_cancel_rec_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
00798                 GOTO(out, rc);
00799         }
00800 
00801         CWARN("5c: print the catalog entries.. we expect 1\n");
00802         cat_counter = 0;
00803         rc = llog_process(env, llh, cat_print_cb, "test 5", NULL);
00804         if (rc) {
00805                 CERROR("5c: process with cat_print_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
00806                 GOTO(out, rc);
00807         }
00808         if (cat_counter != 1) {
00809                 CERROR("5c: %d entries in catalog\n", cat_counter);
00810                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00811         }
00812 
00813         CWARN("5d: add 1 record to the log with many canceled empty pages\n");
00814         rc = llog_cat_add(env, llh, &lmr.lmr_hdr, NULL);
00815         if (rc) {
00816                 CERROR("5d: add record to the log with many canceled empty "
00817                        "pages failed\n");
00818                 GOTO(out, rc);
00819         }
00820 
00821         CWARN("5e: print plain log entries.. expect 6\n");
00822         plain_counter = 0;
00823         rc = llog_cat_process(env, llh, plain_print_cb, "foobar", 0, 0);
00824         if (rc) {
00825                 CERROR("5e: process with plain_print_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
00826                 GOTO(out, rc);
00827         }
00828         if (plain_counter != 6) {
00829                 CERROR("5e: found %d records\n", plain_counter);
00830                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00831         }
00832 
00833         CWARN("5f: print plain log entries reversely.. expect 6\n");
00834         plain_counter = 0;
00835         rc = llog_cat_reverse_process(env, llh, plain_print_cb, "foobar");
00836         if (rc) {
00837                 CERROR("5f: reversely process with plain_print_cb failed: "
00838                        "%d\n", rc);
00839                 GOTO(out, rc);
00840         }
00841         if (plain_counter != 6) {
00842                 CERROR("5f: found %d records\n", plain_counter);
00843                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00844         }
00845 
00846 out:
00847         CWARN("5g: close re-opened catalog\n");
00848         rc2 = llog_cat_close(env, llh);
00849         if (rc2) {
00850                 CERROR("5g: close log %s failed: %d\n", name, rc2);
00851                 if (rc == 0)
00852                         rc = rc2;
00853         }
00854 out_put:
00855         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00856 
00857         RETURN(rc);
00858 }

00860 /* Test client api; open log by name and process */
00861 static int llog_test_6(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd,
00862                        char *name)
00863 {
00864         struct obd_device       *mgc_obd;
00865         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00866         struct obd_uuid         *mgs_uuid;
00867         struct obd_export       *exp;
00868         struct obd_uuid          uuid = { "LLOG_TEST6_UUID" };
00869         struct llog_handle      *llh = NULL;
00870         struct llog_ctxt        *nctxt;
00871         int                      rc, rc2;
00872 
00873         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT);
00874         LASSERT(ctxt);
00875         mgs_uuid = &ctxt->loc_exp->exp_obd->obd_uuid;
00876 
00877         CWARN("6a: re-open log %s using client API\n", name);
00878         mgc_obd = class_find_client_obd(mgs_uuid, LUSTRE_MGC_NAME, NULL);
00879         if (mgc_obd == NULL) {
00880                 CERROR("6a: no MGC devices connected to %s found.\n",
00881                        mgs_uuid->uuid);
00882                 GOTO(ctxt_release, rc = -ENOENT);
00883         }
00884 
00885         rc = obd_connect(NULL, &exp, mgc_obd, &uuid,
00886                          NULL /* obd_connect_data */, NULL);
00887         if (rc != -EALREADY) {
00888                 CERROR("6a: connect on connected MGC (%s) failed to return"
00889                        " -EALREADY\n", mgc_obd->obd_name);
00890                 if (rc == 0)
00891                         obd_disconnect(exp);
00892                 GOTO(ctxt_release, rc = -EINVAL);
00893         }
00894 
00895         nctxt = llog_get_context(mgc_obd, LLOG_CONFIG_REPL_CTXT);
00896         rc = llog_open(env, nctxt, &llh, NULL, name, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
00897         if (rc) {
00898                 CERROR("6a: llog_open failed %d\n", rc);
00899                 GOTO(nctxt_put, rc);
00900         }
00901 
00902         rc = llog_init_handle(env, llh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
00903         if (rc) {
00904                 CERROR("6a: llog_init_handle failed %d\n", rc);
00905                 GOTO(parse_out, rc);
00906         }
00907 
00908         plain_counter = 1; /* llog header is first record */
00909         CWARN("6b: process log %s using client API\n", name);
00910         rc = llog_process(env, llh, plain_print_cb, NULL, NULL);
00911         if (rc)
00912                 CERROR("6b: llog_process failed %d\n", rc);
00913         CWARN("6b: processed %d records\n", plain_counter);
00914 
00915         rc = verify_handle("6b", llh, plain_counter);
00916         if (rc)
00917                 GOTO(parse_out, rc);
00918 
00919         plain_counter = 1; /* llog header is first record */
00920         CWARN("6c: process log %s reversely using client API\n", name);
00921         rc = llog_reverse_process(env, llh, plain_print_cb, NULL, NULL);
00922         if (rc)
00923                 CERROR("6c: llog_reverse_process failed %d\n", rc);
00924         CWARN("6c: processed %d records\n", plain_counter);
00925 
00926         rc = verify_handle("6c", llh, plain_counter);
00927         if (rc)
00928                 GOTO(parse_out, rc);
00929 
00930 parse_out:
00931         rc2 = llog_close(env, llh);
00932         if (rc2) {
00933                 CERROR("6: llog_close failed: rc = %d\n", rc2);
00934                 if (rc == 0)
00935                         rc = rc2;
00936         }
00937 nctxt_put:
00938         llog_ctxt_put(nctxt);
00939 ctxt_release:
00940         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00941         RETURN(rc);
00942 }

00944 static union {
00945         struct llog_rec_hdr             lrh;   /* common header */
00946         struct llog_logid_rec           llr;   /* LLOG_LOGID_MAGIC */
00947         struct llog_unlink64_rec        lur;   /* MDS_UNLINK64_REC */
00948         struct llog_setattr64_rec       lsr64; /* MDS_SETATTR64_REC */
00949         struct llog_size_change_rec     lscr;  /* OST_SZ_REC */
00950         struct llog_changelog_rec       lcr;   /* CHANGELOG_REC */
00951         struct llog_changelog_user_rec  lcur;  /* CHANGELOG_USER_REC */
00952         struct llog_gen_rec             lgr;   /* LLOG_GEN_REC */
00953 } llog_records;

00955 static int test_7_print_cb(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
00956                            struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)

00959

00961 
00962         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "record type %#x at index %d in log "DFID"\n",
00963                rec->lrh_type, rec->lrh_index, PFID(&fid));
00964 
00965         plain_counter++;
00966         return 0;
00967 }

00969 static int test_7_cancel_cb(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
00970                             struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
00971 {
00972         plain_counter++;
00973         /* test LLOG_DEL_RECORD is working */
00974         return LLOG_DEL_RECORD;
00975 }
00976 
00977 static int llog_test_7_sub(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_ctxt *ctxt)
00978 {
00979         struct llog_handle      *llh;
00980         int                      rc = 0, i, process_count;
00981         int                      num_recs = 0;
00982 
00983         ENTRY;
00984 
00985         rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, &llh, NULL, NULL);
00986         if (rc) {
00987                 CERROR("7_sub: create log failed\n");
00988                 RETURN(rc);
00989         }
00990 
00991         rc = llog_init_handle(env, llh,
00992                               LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN | LLOG_F_ZAP_WHEN_EMPTY,
00993                               &uuid);
00994         if (rc) {
00995                 CERROR("7_sub: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
00996                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00997         }
00998         for (i = 0; i < LLOG_HDR_BITMAP_SIZE(llh->lgh_hdr); i++) {
00999                 rc = llog_write(env, llh, &llog_records.lrh, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
01000                 if (rc == -ENOSPC) {
01001                         break;
01002                 } else if (rc < 0) {
01003                         CERROR("7_sub: write recs failed at #%d: %d\n",
01004                                i + 1, rc);
01005                         GOTO(out_close, rc);
01006                 }
01007                 num_recs++;
01008         }
01009         if (rc != -ENOSPC) {
01010                 CWARN("7_sub: write record more than BITMAP size!\n");
01011                 GOTO(out_close, rc = -EINVAL);
01012         }
01013 
01014         rc = verify_handle("7_sub", llh, num_recs + 1);
01015         if (rc) {
01016                 CERROR("7_sub: verify handle failed: %d\n", rc);
01017                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01018         }
01019         if (num_recs < LLOG_HDR_BITMAP_SIZE(llh->lgh_hdr) - 1)
01020                 CWARN("7_sub: records are not aligned, written %d from %u\n",
01021                       num_recs, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP_SIZE(llh->lgh_hdr) - 1);
01022 
01023         plain_counter = 0;
01024         rc = llog_process(env, llh, test_7_print_cb, "test 7", NULL);
01025         if (rc) {
01026                 CERROR("7_sub: llog process failed: %d\n", rc);
01027                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01028         }
01029         process_count = plain_counter;
01030         if (process_count != num_recs) {
01031                 CERROR("7_sub: processed %d records from %d total\n",
01032                        process_count, num_recs);
01033                 GOTO(out_close, rc = -EINVAL);
01034         }
01035 
01036         plain_counter = 0;
01037         rc = llog_reverse_process(env, llh, test_7_cancel_cb, "test 7", NULL);
01038         if (rc && rc != LLOG_DEL_PLAIN) {
01039                 CERROR("7_sub: reverse llog process failed: %d\n", rc);
01040                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01041         }
01042         if (process_count != plain_counter) {
01043                 CERROR("7_sub: Reverse/direct processing found different"
01044                        "number of records: %d/%d\n",
01045                        plain_counter, process_count);
01046                 GOTO(out_close, rc = -EINVAL);
01047         }
01048         if (llog_exist(llh)) {
01049                 CERROR("7_sub: llog exists but should be zapped\n");
01050                 GOTO(out_close, rc = -EEXIST);
01051         }
01052 
01053         rc = verify_handle("7_sub", llh, 1);
01054 out_close:
01055         if (rc)
01056                 llog_destroy(env, llh);
01057         llog_close(env, llh);
01058         RETURN(rc);
01059 }
01060 
01061 /* Test all llog records writing and processing */
01062 static int llog_test_7(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd)
01063 {
01064         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
01065         int                      rc;
01066 
01067         ENTRY;
01068 
01069         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT);
01070 
01071         CWARN("7a: test llog_logid_rec\n");
01072         llog_records.llr.lid_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(llog_records.llr);
01073         llog_records.llr.lid_tail.lrt_len = sizeof(llog_records.llr);
01074         llog_records.llr.lid_hdr.lrh_type = LLOG_LOGID_MAGIC;
01075 
01076         rc = llog_test_7_sub(env, ctxt);
01077         if (rc) {
01078                 CERROR("7a: llog_logid_rec test failed\n");
01079                 GOTO(out, rc);
01080         }
01081 
01082         CWARN("7b: test llog_unlink64_rec\n");
01083         llog_records.lur.lur_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(llog_records.lur);
01084         llog_records.lur.lur_tail.lrt_len = sizeof(llog_records.lur);
01085         llog_records.lur.lur_hdr.lrh_type = MDS_UNLINK64_REC;
01086 
01087         rc = llog_test_7_sub(env, ctxt);
01088         if (rc) {
01089                 CERROR("7b: llog_unlink_rec test failed\n");
01090                 GOTO(out, rc);
01091         }
01092 
01093         CWARN("7c: test llog_setattr64_rec\n");
01094         llog_records.lsr64.lsr_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(llog_records.lsr64);
01095         llog_records.lsr64.lsr_tail.lrt_len = sizeof(llog_records.lsr64);
01096         llog_records.lsr64.lsr_hdr.lrh_type = MDS_SETATTR64_REC;
01097 
01098         rc = llog_test_7_sub(env, ctxt);
01099         if (rc) {
01100                 CERROR("7c: llog_setattr64_rec test failed\n");
01101                 GOTO(out, rc);
01102         }
01103 
01104         CWARN("7d: test llog_size_change_rec\n");
01105         llog_records.lscr.lsc_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(llog_records.lscr);
01106         llog_records.lscr.lsc_tail.lrt_len = sizeof(llog_records.lscr);
01107         llog_records.lscr.lsc_hdr.lrh_type = OST_SZ_REC;
01108 
01109         rc = llog_test_7_sub(env, ctxt);
01110         if (rc) {
01111                 CERROR("7d: llog_size_change_rec test failed\n");
01112                 GOTO(out, rc);
01113         }
01114 
01115         CWARN("7e: test llog_changelog_rec\n");
01116         /* Direct access to cr_do_not_use: peculiar case for this test */
01117         llog_records.lcr.cr_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(llog_records.lcr);
01118         llog_records.lcr.cr_do_not_use.lrt_len = sizeof(llog_records.lcr);
01119         llog_records.lcr.cr_hdr.lrh_type = CHANGELOG_REC;
01120 
01121         rc = llog_test_7_sub(env, ctxt);
01122         if (rc) {
01123                 CERROR("7e: llog_changelog_rec test failed\n");
01124                 GOTO(out, rc);
01125         }
01126 
01127         CWARN("7f: test llog_changelog_user_rec\n");
01128         llog_records.lcur.cur_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(llog_records.lcur);
01129         llog_records.lcur.cur_tail.lrt_len = sizeof(llog_records.lcur);
01130         llog_records.lcur.cur_hdr.lrh_type = CHANGELOG_USER_REC;
01131 
01132         rc = llog_test_7_sub(env, ctxt);
01133         if (rc) {
01134                 CERROR("7f: llog_changelog_user_rec test failed\n");
01135                 GOTO(out, rc);
01136         }
01137 
01138         CWARN("7g: test llog_gen_rec\n");
01139         llog_records.lgr.lgr_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(llog_records.lgr);
01140         llog_records.lgr.lgr_tail.lrt_len = sizeof(llog_records.lgr);
01141         llog_records.lgr.lgr_hdr.lrh_type = LLOG_GEN_REC;
01142 
01143         rc = llog_test_7_sub(env, ctxt);
01144         if (rc) {
01145                 CERROR("7g: llog_size_change_rec test failed\n");
01146                 GOTO(out, rc);
01147         }
01148 out:
01149         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01150         RETURN(rc);
01151 }
01152 
01153 static int llog_truncate(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *o)
01154 {
01155         struct lu_attr           la;
01156         struct thandle          *th;
01157         struct dt_device        *d;
01158         int                      rc;
01159         ENTRY;
01160 
01161         LASSERT(o);
01162         d = lu2dt_dev(o->do_lu.lo_dev);
01163         LASSERT(d);
01164 
01165         rc = dt_attr_get(env, o, &la);
01166         if (rc)
01167                 RETURN(rc);
01168 
01169         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "original size "LPU64"\n", la.la_size);
01170         rc = sizeof(struct llog_log_hdr) + sizeof(struct llog_mini_rec);
01171         if (la.la_size < rc) {
01172                 CERROR("too small llog: "LPU64"\n", la.la_size);
01173                 RETURN(0);
01174         }
01175 
01176         /* drop 2 records */
01177         la.la_size = la.la_size - (sizeof(struct llog_mini_rec) * 2);
01178         la.la_valid = LA_SIZE;
01179 
01180         th = dt_trans_create(env, d);
01181         if (IS_ERR(th))
01182                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(th));
01183 
01184         rc = dt_declare_attr_set(env, o, &la, th);
01185         if (rc)
01186                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01187 
01188         rc = dt_declare_punch(env, o, la.la_size, OBD_OBJECT_EOF, th);
01189 
01190         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, d, th);
01191         if (rc)
01192                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01193 
01194         rc = dt_punch(env, o, la.la_size, OBD_OBJECT_EOF, th);
01195         if (rc)
01196                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01197 
01198         rc = dt_attr_set(env, o, &la, th);
01199         if (rc)
01200                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01201 
01202 stop:
01203         dt_trans_stop(env, d, th);
01204 
01205         RETURN(rc);
01206 }
01207 
01208 static int test_8_cb(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
01209                           struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
01210 {
01211         plain_counter++;
01212         return 0;
01213 }
01214 
01215 static int llog_test_8(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd)
01216 {
01217         struct llog_handle      *llh = NULL;
01218         char                     name[10];
01219         int                      rc, rc2, i;
01220         int                      orig_counter;
01221         struct llog_mini_rec     lmr;
01222         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
01223         struct dt_object        *obj = NULL;
01224 
01225         ENTRY;
01226 
01227         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT);
01228         LASSERT(ctxt);
01229 
01230         lmr.lmr_hdr.lrh_len = lmr.lmr_tail.lrt_len = LLOG_MIN_REC_SIZE;
01231         lmr.lmr_hdr.lrh_type = 0xf00f00;
01232 
01233         CWARN("8a: fill the first plain llog\n");
01234         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &llh, &cat_logid, NULL, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01235         if (rc) {
01236                 CERROR("8a: llog_create with logid failed: %d\n", rc);
01237                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
01238         }
01239 
01240         rc = llog_init_handle(env, llh, LLOG_F_IS_CAT, &uuid);
01241         if (rc) {
01242                 CERROR("8a: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
01243                 GOTO(out, rc);
01244         }
01245 
01246         plain_counter = 0;
01247         rc = llog_cat_process(env, llh, test_8_cb, "foobar", 0, 0);
01248         if (rc != 0) {
01249                 CERROR("5a: process with test_8_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01250                 GOTO(out, rc);
01251         }
01252         orig_counter = plain_counter;
01253 
01254         for (i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
01255                 rc = llog_cat_add(env, llh, &lmr.lmr_hdr, NULL);
01256                 if (rc) {
01257                         CERROR("5a: add record failed\n");
01258                         GOTO(out, rc);
01259                 }
01260         }
01261 
01262         /* grab the current plain llog, we'll corrupt it later */
01263         obj = llh->u.chd.chd_current_log->lgh_obj;
01264         LASSERT(obj);
01265         lu_object_get(&obj->do_lu);
01266         CWARN("8a: pin llog "DFID"\n", PFID(lu_object_fid(&obj->do_lu)));
01267 
01268         rc2 = llog_cat_close(env, llh);
01269         if (rc2) {
01270                 CERROR("8a: close log %s failed: %d\n", name, rc2);
01271                 if (rc == 0)
01272                         rc = rc2;
01273                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
01274         }
01275 
01276         CWARN("8b: fill the second plain llog\n");
01277         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &llh, &cat_logid, NULL, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01278         if (rc) {
01279                 CERROR("8b: llog_create with logid failed: %d\n", rc);
01280                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
01281         }
01282 
01283         rc = llog_init_handle(env, llh, LLOG_F_IS_CAT, &uuid);
01284         if (rc) {
01285                 CERROR("8b: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
01286                 GOTO(out, rc);
01287         }
01288 
01289         for (i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
01290                 rc = llog_cat_add(env, llh, &lmr.lmr_hdr, NULL);
01291                 if (rc) {
01292                         CERROR("8b: add record failed\n");
01293                         GOTO(out, rc);
01294                 }
01295         }
01296         CWARN("8b: second llog "DFID"\n",
01297                 PFID(lu_object_fid(&llh->u.chd.chd_current_log->lgh_obj->do_lu)));
01298 
01299         rc2 = llog_cat_close(env, llh);
01300         if (rc2) {
01301                 CERROR("8b: close log %s failed: %d\n", name, rc2);
01302                 if (rc == 0)
01303                         rc = rc2;
01304                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
01305         }
01306 
01307         CWARN("8c: drop two records from the first plain llog\n");
01308         llog_truncate(env, obj);
01309 
01310         CWARN("8d: count survived records\n");
01311         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &llh, &cat_logid, NULL, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01312         if (rc) {
01313                 CERROR("8d: llog_create with logid failed: %d\n", rc);
01314                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
01315         }
01316 
01317         rc = llog_init_handle(env, llh, LLOG_F_IS_CAT, &uuid);
01318         if (rc) {
01319                 CERROR("8d: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
01320                 GOTO(out, rc);
01321         }
01322 
01323         plain_counter = 0;
01324         rc = llog_cat_process(env, llh, test_8_cb, "foobar", 0, 0);
01325         if (rc != 0) {
01326                 CERROR("8d: process with test_8_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01327                 GOTO(out, rc);
01328         }
01329 
01330         if (orig_counter + 200 - 2 != plain_counter) {
01331                 CERROR("found %d records (expected %d)\n", plain_counter,
01332                        orig_counter + 200 - 2);
01333                 rc = -EIO;
01334         }
01335 
01336 out:
01337         CWARN("8d: close re-opened catalog\n");
01338         rc2 = llog_cat_close(env, llh);
01339         if (rc2) {
01340                 CERROR("8d: close log %s failed: %d\n", name, rc2);
01341                 if (rc == 0)
01342                         rc = rc2;
01343         }
01344 out_put:
01345         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01346 
01347         if (obj != NULL)
01348                 lu_object_put(env, &obj->do_lu);
01349 
01350         RETURN(rc);
01351 }
01352 
01353 static int llog_test_9_sub(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_ctxt *ctxt)
01354 {
01355         struct llog_handle      *llh;
01356         struct lu_fid            fid;
01357         int                      rc = 0;
01358 
01359         ENTRY;
01360 
01361         rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, &llh, NULL, NULL);
01362         if (rc != 0) {
01363                 CERROR("9_sub: create log failed\n");
01364                 RETURN(rc);
01365         }
01366 
01367         rc = llog_init_handle(env, llh,
01368                               LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN | LLOG_F_ZAP_WHEN_EMPTY,
01369                               &uuid);
01370         if (rc != 0) {
01371                 CERROR("9_sub: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
01372                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01373         }
01374 
01375         logid_to_fid(&llh->lgh_id, &fid);
01376         fid_to_logid(&fid, &llog_records.llr.lid_id);
01377         rc = llog_write(env, llh, &llog_records.lrh, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
01378         if (rc < 0) {
01379                 CERROR("9_sub: write recs failed at #1: %d\n", rc);
01380                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01381         }
01382         CWARN("9_sub: record type %x in log "DFID_NOBRACE"\n",
01383               llog_records.lrh.lrh_type, PFID(&fid));
01384 out_close:
01385         llog_close(env, llh);
01386         RETURN(rc);
01387 }
