01448 
01449 /* test catalog wrap around */
01450 static int llog_test_10(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd)
01451 {
01452         struct llog_handle      *cath;
01453         char                     name[10];
01454         int                      rc, rc2, i, enospc, eok;
01455         struct llog_mini_rec     lmr;
01456         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
01457         struct lu_attr           la;
01458         __u64                    cat_max_size;
01459         struct dt_device        *dt;
01460 
01461         ENTRY;
01462 
01463         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT);
01464         LASSERT(ctxt);
01465 
01466         lmr.lmr_hdr.lrh_len = lmr.lmr_tail.lrt_len = LLOG_MIN_REC_SIZE;
01467         lmr.lmr_hdr.lrh_type = 0xf00f00;
01468 
01469         snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "%x", llog_test_rand + 2);
01470         CWARN("10a: create a catalog log with name: %s\n", name);
01471         rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, &cath, NULL, name);
01472         if (rc) {
01473                 CERROR("10a: llog_create with name %s failed: %d\n", name, rc);
01474                 GOTO(ctxt_release, rc);
01475         }
01476         rc = llog_init_handle(env, cath, LLOG_F_IS_CAT, &uuid);
01477         if (rc) {
01478                 CERROR("10a: can't init llog handle: %d\n", rc);
01479                 GOTO(out, rc);
01480         }
01481 
01482         cat_logid = cath->lgh_id;
01483         dt = lu2dt_dev(cath->lgh_obj->do_lu.lo_dev);
01484 
01485         /* sync device to commit all recent LLOG changes to disk and avoid
01486          * to consume a huge space with delayed journal commit callbacks
01487          * particularly on low memory nodes or VMs */
01488         rc = dt_sync(env, dt);
01489         if (rc) {
01490                 CERROR("10c: sync failed: %d\n", rc);
01491                 GOTO(out, rc);
01492         }
01493 
01494         /* force catalog wrap for 5th plain LLOG */
01495         cfs_fail_loc = CFS_FAIL_SKIP|OBD_FAIL_CAT_RECORDS;
01496         cfs_fail_val = 4;
01497 
01498         CWARN("10b: write %d log records\n", LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
01499         for (i = 0; i < LLOG_TEST_RECNUM; i++) {
01500                 rc = llog_cat_add(env, cath, &lmr.lmr_hdr, NULL);
01501                 if (rc) {
01502                         CERROR("10b: write %d records failed at #%d: %d\n",
01503                                LLOG_TEST_RECNUM, i + 1, rc);
01504                         GOTO(out, rc);
01505                 }
01506         }
01507 
01508         /* make sure 2 new plain llog appears in catalog (+1 with hdr) */
01509         rc = verify_handle("10b", cath, 3);
01510         if (rc)
01511                 GOTO(out, rc);
01512 
01513         /* sync device to commit all recent LLOG changes to disk and avoid
01514          * to consume a huge space with delayed journal commit callbacks
01515          * particularly on low memory nodes or VMs */
01516         rc = dt_sync(env, dt);
01517         if (rc) {
01518                 CERROR("10b: sync failed: %d\n", rc);
01519                 GOTO(out, rc);
01520         }
01521 
01522         CWARN("10c: write %d more log records\n", 2 * LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
01523         for (i = 0; i < 2 * LLOG_TEST_RECNUM; i++) {
01524                 rc = llog_cat_add(env, cath, &lmr.lmr_hdr, NULL);
01525                 if (rc) {
01526                         CERROR("10c: write %d records failed at #%d: %d\n",
01527                                2*LLOG_TEST_RECNUM, i + 1, rc);
01528                         GOTO(out, rc);
01529                 }
01530         }
01531 
01532         /* make sure 2 new plain llog appears in catalog (+1 with hdr) */
01533         rc = verify_handle("10c", cath, 5);
01534         if (rc)
01535                 GOTO(out, rc);
01536 
01537         /* sync device to commit all recent LLOG changes to disk and avoid
01538          * to consume a huge space with delayed journal commit callbacks
01539          * particularly on low memory nodes or VMs */
01540         rc = dt_sync(env, dt);
01541         if (rc) {
01542                 CERROR("10c: sync failed: %d\n", rc);
01543                 GOTO(out, rc);
01544         }
01545 
01546         /* fill last allocated plain LLOG and reach -ENOSPC condition
01547          * because no slot available in Catalog */
01548         enospc = 0;
01549         eok = 0;
01550         CWARN("10c: write %d more log records\n", LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
01551         for (i = 0; i < LLOG_TEST_RECNUM; i++) {
01552                 rc = llog_cat_add(env, cath, &lmr.lmr_hdr, NULL);
01553                 if (rc && rc != -ENOSPC) {
01554                         CERROR("10c: write %d records failed at #%d: %d\n",
01555                                LLOG_TEST_RECNUM, i + 1, rc);
01556                         GOTO(out, rc);
01557                 }
01558                 /* after last added plain LLOG has filled up, all new
01559                  * records add should fail with -ENOSPC */
01560                 if (rc == -ENOSPC) {
01561                         enospc++;
01562                 } else {
01563                         enospc = 0;
01564                         eok++;
01565                 }
01566         }
01567 
01568         if ((enospc == 0) && (enospc+eok != LLOG_TEST_RECNUM)) {
01569                 CERROR("10c: all last records adds should have failed with"
01570                        " -ENOSPC\n");
01571                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01572         }
01573 
01574         CWARN("10c: wrote %d records then %d failed with ENOSPC\n", eok,
01575               enospc);
01576 
01577         /* make sure no new record in Catalog */
01578         rc = verify_handle("10c", cath, 5);
01579         if (rc)
01580                 GOTO(out, rc);
01581 
01582         /* Catalog should have reached its max size for test */
01583         rc = dt_attr_get(env, cath->lgh_obj, &la);
01584         if (rc) {
01585                 CERROR("10c: failed to get catalog attrs: %d\n", rc);
01586                 GOTO(out, rc);
01587         }
01588         cat_max_size = la.la_size;
01589 
01590         /* cancel all 1st plain llog records to empty it, this will also cause
01591          * its catalog entry to be freed for next forced wrap in 10e */
01592         CWARN("10d: Cancel %d records, see one log zapped\n", LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
01593         cancel_count = 0;
01594         rc = llog_cat_process(env, cath, llog_cancel_rec_cb, "foobar", 0, 0);
01595         if (rc != -LLOG_EEMPTY) {
01596                 CERROR("10d: process with llog_cancel_rec_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01597                 /* need to indicate error if for any reason LLOG_TEST_RECNUM is
01598                  * not reached */
01599                 if (rc == 0)
01600                         rc = -ERANGE;
01601                 GOTO(out, rc);
01602         }
01603 
01604         CWARN("10d: print the catalog entries.. we expect 3\n");
01605         cat_counter = 0;
01606         rc = llog_process(env, cath, cat_print_cb, "test 10", NULL);
01607         if (rc) {
01608                 CERROR("10d: process with cat_print_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01609                 GOTO(out, rc);
01610         }
01611         if (cat_counter != 3) {
01612                 CERROR("10d: %d entries in catalog\n", cat_counter);
01613                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01614         }
01615 
01616         /* verify one down in catalog (+1 with hdr) */
01617         rc = verify_handle("10d", cath, 4);
01618         if (rc)
01619                 GOTO(out, rc);
01620 
01621         /* sync device to commit all recent LLOG changes to disk and avoid
01622          * to consume a huge space with delayed journal commit callbacks
01623          * particularly on low memory nodes or VMs */
01624         rc = dt_sync(env, dt);
01625         if (rc) {
01626                 CERROR("10d: sync failed: %d\n", rc);
01627                 GOTO(out, rc);
01628         }
01629 
01630         enospc = 0;
01631         eok = 0;
01632         CWARN("10e: write %d more log records\n", LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
01633         for (i = 0; i < LLOG_TEST_RECNUM; i++) {
01634                 rc = llog_cat_add(env, cath, &lmr.lmr_hdr, NULL);
01635                 if (rc && rc != -ENOSPC) {
01636                         CERROR("10e: write %d records failed at #%d: %d\n",
01637                                LLOG_TEST_RECNUM, i + 1, rc);
01638                         GOTO(out, rc);
01639                 }
01640                 /* after last added plain LLOG has filled up, all new
01641                  * records add should fail with -ENOSPC */
01642                 if (rc == -ENOSPC) {
01643                         enospc++;
01644                 } else {
01645                         enospc = 0;
01646                         eok++;
01647                 }
01648         }
01649 
01650         if ((enospc == 0) && (enospc+eok != LLOG_TEST_RECNUM)) {
01651                 CERROR("10e: all last records adds should have failed with"
01652                        " -ENOSPC\n");
01653                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01654         }
01655 
01656         CWARN("10e: wrote %d records then %d failed with ENOSPC\n", eok,
01657               enospc);
01658 
01659         CWARN("10e: print the catalog entries.. we expect 4\n");
01660         cat_counter = 0;
01661         rc = llog_process(env, cath, cat_print_cb, "test 10", NULL);
01662         if (rc) {
01663                 CERROR("10d: process with cat_print_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01664                 GOTO(out, rc);
01665         }
01666         if (cat_counter != 4) {
01667                 CERROR("10d: %d entries in catalog\n", cat_counter);
01668                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01669         }
01670 
01671         /* make sure 1 new plain llog appears in catalog (+1 with hdr) */
01672         rc = verify_handle("10e", cath, 5);
01673         if (rc)
01674                 GOTO(out, rc);
01675 
01676         /* verify catalog has wrap around */
01677         if (cath->lgh_last_idx > cath->lgh_hdr->llh_cat_idx) {
01678                 CERROR("10e: catalog failed to wrap around\n");
01679                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01680         }
01681 
01682         rc = dt_attr_get(env, cath->lgh_obj, &la);
01683         if (rc) {
01684                 CERROR("10e: failed to get catalog attrs: %d\n", rc);
01685                 GOTO(out, rc);
01686         }
01687 
01688         if (la.la_size != cat_max_size) {
01689                 CERROR("10e: catalog size has changed after it has wrap around,"
01690                        " current size = "LPU64", expected size = "LPU64"\n",
01691                        la.la_size, cat_max_size);
01692                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01693         }
01694         CWARN("10e: catalog successfully wrap around, last_idx %d, first %d\n",
01695               cath->lgh_last_idx, cath->lgh_hdr->llh_cat_idx);
01696 
01697         /* sync device to commit all recent LLOG changes to disk and avoid
01698          * to consume a huge space with delayed journal commit callbacks
01699          * particularly on low memory nodes or VMs */
01700         rc = dt_sync(env, dt);
01701         if (rc) {
01702                 CERROR("10e: sync failed: %d\n", rc);
01703                 GOTO(out, rc);
01704         }
01705 
01706         /* cancel more records to free one more slot in Catalog
01707          * see if it is re-allocated when adding more records */
01708         CWARN("10f: Cancel %d records, see one log zapped\n", LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
01709         cancel_count = 0;
01710         rc = llog_cat_process(env, cath, llog_cancel_rec_cb, "foobar", 0, 0);
01711         if (rc != -LLOG_EEMPTY) {
01712                 CERROR("10f: process with llog_cancel_rec_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01713                 /* need to indicate error if for any reason LLOG_TEST_RECNUM is
01714                  * not reached */
01715                 if (rc == 0)
01716                         rc = -ERANGE;
01717                 GOTO(out, rc);
01718         }
01719 
01720         CWARN("10f: print the catalog entries.. we expect 3\n");
01721         cat_counter = 0;
01722         rc = llog_process(env, cath, cat_print_cb, "test 10", NULL);
01723         if (rc) {
01724                 CERROR("10f: process with cat_print_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01725                 GOTO(out, rc);
01726         }
01727         if (cat_counter != 3) {
01728                 CERROR("10f: %d entries in catalog\n", cat_counter);
01729                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01730         }
01731 
01732         /* verify one down in catalog (+1 with hdr) */
01733         rc = verify_handle("10f", cath, 4);
01734         if (rc)
01735                 GOTO(out, rc);
01736 
01737         /* sync device to commit all recent LLOG changes to disk and avoid
01738          * to consume a huge space with delayed journal commit callbacks
01739          * particularly on low memory nodes or VMs */
01740         rc = dt_sync(env, dt);
01741         if (rc) {
01742                 CERROR("10f: sync failed: %d\n", rc);
01743                 GOTO(out, rc);
01744         }
01745 
01746         enospc = 0;
01747         eok = 0;
01748         CWARN("10f: write %d more log records\n", LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
01749         for (i = 0; i < LLOG_TEST_RECNUM; i++) {
01750                 rc = llog_cat_add(env, cath, &lmr.lmr_hdr, NULL);
01751                 if (rc && rc != -ENOSPC) {
01752                         CERROR("10f: write %d records failed at #%d: %d\n",
01753                                LLOG_TEST_RECNUM, i + 1, rc);
01754                         GOTO(out, rc);
01755                 }
01756                 /* after last added plain LLOG has filled up, all new
01757                  * records add should fail with -ENOSPC */
01758                 if (rc == -ENOSPC) {
01759                         enospc++;
01760                 } else {
01761                         enospc = 0;
01762                         eok++;
01763                 }
01764         }
01765 
01766         if ((enospc == 0) && (enospc+eok != LLOG_TEST_RECNUM)) {
01767                 CERROR("10f: all last records adds should have failed with"
01768                        " -ENOSPC\n");
01769                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01770         }
01771 
01772         CWARN("10f: wrote %d records then %d failed with ENOSPC\n", eok,
01773               enospc);
01774 
01775         /* make sure 1 new plain llog appears in catalog (+1 with hdr) */
01776         rc = verify_handle("10f", cath, 5);
01777         if (rc)
01778                 GOTO(out, rc);
01779 
01780         /* verify lgh_last_idx = llh_cat_idx = 2 now */
01781         if (cath->lgh_last_idx != cath->lgh_hdr->llh_cat_idx ||
01782             cath->lgh_last_idx != 2) {
01783                 CERROR("10f: lgh_last_idx = %d vs 2, llh_cat_idx = %d vs 2\n",
01784                        cath->lgh_last_idx, cath->lgh_hdr->llh_cat_idx);
01785                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01786         }
01787 
01788         rc = dt_attr_get(env, cath->lgh_obj, &la);
01789         if (rc) {
01790                 CERROR("10f: failed to get catalog attrs: %d\n", rc);
01791                 GOTO(out, rc);
01792         }
01793 
01794         if (la.la_size != cat_max_size) {
01795                 CERROR("10f: catalog size has changed after it has wrap around,"
01796                        " current size = "LPU64", expected size = "LPU64"\n",
01797                        la.la_size, cat_max_size);
01798                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01799         }
01800 
01801         /* sync device to commit all recent LLOG changes to disk and avoid
01802          * to consume a huge space with delayed journal commit callbacks
01803          * particularly on low memory nodes or VMs */
01804         rc = dt_sync(env, dt);
01805         if (rc) {
01806                 CERROR("10f: sync failed: %d\n", rc);
01807                 GOTO(out, rc);
01808         }
01809 
01810         /* will llh_cat_idx also successfully wrap ? */
01811 
01812         /* cancel all records in the plain LLOGs referenced by 2 last indexes in
01813          * Catalog */
01814 
01815         /* cancel more records to free one more slot in Catalog */
01816         CWARN("10g: Cancel %d records, see one log zapped\n", LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
01817         cancel_count = 0;
01818         rc = llog_cat_process(env, cath, llog_cancel_rec_cb, "foobar", 0, 0);
01819         if (rc != -LLOG_EEMPTY) {
01820                 CERROR("10g: process with llog_cancel_rec_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01821                 /* need to indicate error if for any reason LLOG_TEST_RECNUM is
01822                  * not reached */
01823                 if (rc == 0)
01824                         rc = -ERANGE;
01825                 GOTO(out, rc);
01826         }
01827 
01828         CWARN("10g: print the catalog entries.. we expect 3\n");
01829         cat_counter = 0;
01830         rc = llog_process(env, cath, cat_print_cb, "test 10", NULL);
01831         if (rc) {
01832                 CERROR("10g: process with cat_print_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01833                 GOTO(out, rc);
01834         }
01835         if (cat_counter != 3) {
01836                 CERROR("10g: %d entries in catalog\n", cat_counter);
01837                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01838         }
01839 
01840         /* verify one down in catalog (+1 with hdr) */
01841         rc = verify_handle("10g", cath, 4);
01842         if (rc)
01843                 GOTO(out, rc);
01844 
01845         /* sync device to commit all recent LLOG changes to disk and avoid
01846          * to consume a huge space with delayed journal commit callbacks
01847          * particularly on low memory nodes or VMs */
01848         rc = dt_sync(env, dt);
01849         if (rc) {
01850                 CERROR("10g: sync failed: %d\n", rc);
01851                 GOTO(out, rc);
01852         }
01853 
01854         /* cancel more records to free one more slot in Catalog */
01855         CWARN("10g: Cancel %d records, see one log zapped\n", LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
01856         cancel_count = 0;
01857         rc = llog_cat_process(env, cath, llog_cancel_rec_cb, "foobar", 0, 0);
01858         if (rc != -LLOG_EEMPTY) {
01859                 CERROR("10g: process with llog_cancel_rec_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01860                 /* need to indicate error if for any reason LLOG_TEST_RECNUM is
01861                  * not reached */
01862                 if (rc == 0)
01863                         rc = -ERANGE;
01864                 GOTO(out, rc);
01865         }
01866 
01867         CWARN("10g: print the catalog entries.. we expect 2\n");
01868         cat_counter = 0;
01869         rc = llog_process(env, cath, cat_print_cb, "test 10", NULL);
01870         if (rc) {
01871                 CERROR("10g: process with cat_print_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01872                 GOTO(out, rc);
01873         }
01874         if (cat_counter != 2) {
01875                 CERROR("10g: %d entries in catalog\n", cat_counter);
01876                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01877         }
01878 
01879         /* verify one down in catalog (+1 with hdr) */
01880         rc = verify_handle("10g", cath, 3);
01881         if (rc)
01882                 GOTO(out, rc);
01883 
01884         /* verify lgh_last_idx = 2 and llh_cat_idx = 0 now */
01885         if (cath->lgh_hdr->llh_cat_idx != 0 ||
01886             cath->lgh_last_idx != 2) {
01887                 CERROR("10g: lgh_last_idx = %d vs 2, llh_cat_idx = %d vs 0\n",
01888                        cath->lgh_last_idx, cath->lgh_hdr->llh_cat_idx);
01889                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01890         }
01891 
01892         /* sync device to commit all recent LLOG changes to disk and avoid
01893          * to consume a huge space with delayed journal commit callbacks
01894          * particularly on low memory nodes or VMs */
01895         rc = dt_sync(env, dt);
01896         if (rc) {
01897                 CERROR("10g: sync failed: %d\n", rc);
01898                 GOTO(out, rc);
01899         }
01900 
01901         /* cancel more records to free one more slot in Catalog */
01902         CWARN("10g: Cancel %d records, see one log zapped\n", LLOG_TEST_RECNUM);
01903         cancel_count = 0;
01904         rc = llog_cat_process(env, cath, llog_cancel_rec_cb, "foobar", 0, 0);
01905         if (rc != -LLOG_EEMPTY) {
01906                 CERROR("10g: process with llog_cancel_rec_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01907                 /* need to indicate error if for any reason LLOG_TEST_RECNUM is
01908                  * not reached */
01909                 if (rc == 0)
01910                         rc = -ERANGE;
01911                 GOTO(out, rc);
01912         }
01913 
01914         CWARN("10g: print the catalog entries.. we expect 1\n");
01915         cat_counter = 0;
01916         rc = llog_process(env, cath, cat_print_cb, "test 10", NULL);
01917         if (rc) {
01918                 CERROR("10g: process with cat_print_cb failed: %d\n", rc);
01919                 GOTO(out, rc);
01920         }
01921         if (cat_counter != 1) {
01922                 CERROR("10g: %d entries in catalog\n", cat_counter);
01923                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01924         }
01925 
01926         /* verify one down in catalog (+1 with hdr) */
01927         rc = verify_handle("10g", cath, 2);
01928         if (rc)
01929                 GOTO(out, rc);
01930 
01931         /* verify lgh_last_idx = 2 and llh_cat_idx = 1 now */
01932         if (cath->lgh_hdr->llh_cat_idx != 1 ||
01933             cath->lgh_last_idx != 2) {
01934                 CERROR("10g: lgh_last_idx = %d vs 2, llh_cat_idx = %d vs 1\n",
01935                        cath->lgh_last_idx, cath->lgh_hdr->llh_cat_idx);
01936                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01937         }
01938 
01939         CWARN("10g: llh_cat_idx has also successfully wrapped!\n");
01940 
01941 out:
01942         cfs_fail_loc = 0;
01943         cfs_fail_val = 0;
01944 
01945         CWARN("10: put newly-created catalog\n");
01946         rc2 = llog_cat_close(env, cath);
01947         if (rc2) {
01948                 CERROR("10: close log %s failed: %d\n", name, rc2);
01949                 if (rc == 0)
01950                         rc = rc2;
01951         }
01952 ctxt_release:
01953         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01954         RETURN(rc);
01955 }
01956 
01957 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
01958  * Tests above, boring obd functions below
01959  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
01960 static int llog_run_tests(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd)
01961 {
01962         struct llog_handle      *llh = NULL;
01963         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
01964         int                      rc, err;
01965         char                     name[10];
01966 
01967         ENTRY;
01968         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT);
01969         LASSERT(ctxt);
01970 
01971         sprintf(name, "%x", llog_test_rand);
01972 
01973         rc = llog_test_1(env, obd, name);
01974         if (rc)
01975                 GOTO(cleanup_ctxt, rc);
01976 
01977         rc = llog_test_2(env, obd, name, &llh);
01978         if (rc)
01979                 GOTO(cleanup_ctxt, rc);
01980 
01981         rc = llog_test_3(env, obd, llh);
01982         if (rc)
01983                 GOTO(cleanup, rc);
01984 
01985         rc = llog_test_4(env, obd);
01986         if (rc)
01987                 GOTO(cleanup, rc);
01988 
01989         rc = llog_test_5(env, obd);
01990         if (rc)
01991                 GOTO(cleanup, rc);
01992 
01993         rc = llog_test_6(env, obd, name);
01994         if (rc)
01995                 GOTO(cleanup, rc);
01996 
01997         rc = llog_test_7(env, obd);
01998         if (rc)
01999                 GOTO(cleanup, rc);
02000 
02001         rc = llog_test_8(env, obd);
02002         if (rc)
02003                 GOTO(cleanup, rc);
02004 
02005         rc = llog_test_9(env, obd);
02006         if (rc != 0)
02007                 GOTO(cleanup, rc);
02008 
02009         rc = llog_test_10(env, obd);
02010         if (rc)
02011                 GOTO(cleanup, rc);
02012 
02013 cleanup:
02014         err = llog_destroy(env, llh);
02015         if (err)
02016                 CERROR("cleanup: llog_destroy failed: %d\n", err);
02017         llog_close(env, llh);
02018         if (rc == 0)
02019                 rc = err;
02020 cleanup_ctxt:
02021         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
02022         return rc;
02023 }
02024 
02025 static int llog_test_cleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
02026 {
02027         struct obd_device       *tgt;
02028         struct lu_env            env;
02029         int                      rc;
02030 
02031         ENTRY;
02032 
02033         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_LOCAL | LCT_MG_THREAD);
02034         if (rc)
02035                 RETURN(rc);
02036 
02037         tgt = obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt->dd_lu_dev.ld_obd;
02038         rc = llog_cleanup(&env, llog_get_context(tgt, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT));
02039         if (rc)
02040                 CERROR("failed to llog_test_llog_finish: %d\n", rc);
02041         lu_env_fini(&env);
02042         RETURN(rc);
02043 }
02044 
02045 static int llog_test_setup(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
02046 {
02047         struct obd_device       *tgt;
02048         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
02049         struct dt_object        *o;
02050         struct lu_env            env;
02051         struct lu_context        test_session;
02052         int                      rc;
02053 
02054         ENTRY;
02055 
02056         if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount < 2) {
02057                 CERROR("requires a TARGET OBD name\n");
02058                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
02059         }
02060 
02061         if (lcfg->lcfg_buflens[1] < 1) {
02062                 CERROR("requires a TARGET OBD name\n");
02063                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
02064         }
02065 
02066         /* disk obd */
02067         tgt = class_name2obd(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
02068         if (!tgt || !tgt->obd_attached || !tgt->obd_set_up) {
02069                 CERROR("target device not attached or not set up (%s)\n",
02070                        lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
02071                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
02072         }
02073 
02074         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_LOCAL | LCT_MG_THREAD);
02075         if (rc)
02076                 RETURN(rc);
02077 
02078         rc = lu_context_init(&test_session, LCT_SERVER_SESSION);
02079         if (rc)
02080                 GOTO(cleanup_env, rc);
02081         test_session.lc_thread = (struct ptlrpc_thread *)current;
02082         lu_context_enter(&test_session);
02083         env.le_ses = &test_session;
02084 
02085         CWARN("Setup llog-test device over %s device\n",
02086               lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
02087 
02088         OBD_SET_CTXT_MAGIC(&obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt);
02089         obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt = lu2dt_dev(tgt->obd_lu_dev);
02090 
02091         rc = llog_setup(&env, tgt, &tgt->obd_olg, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT, tgt,
02092                         &llog_osd_ops);
02093         if (rc)
02094                 GOTO(cleanup_session, rc);
02095 
02096         /* use MGS llog dir for tests */
02097         ctxt = llog_get_context(tgt, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
02098         LASSERT(ctxt);
02099         o = ctxt->loc_dir;
02100         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
02101 
02102         ctxt = llog_get_context(tgt, LLOG_TEST_ORIG_CTXT);
02103         LASSERT(ctxt);
02104         ctxt->loc_dir = o;
02105         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
02106 
02107         llog_test_rand = cfs_rand();
02108 
02109         rc = llog_run_tests(&env, tgt);
02110         if (rc)
02111                 llog_test_cleanup(obd);
02112 cleanup_session:
02113         lu_context_exit(&test_session);
02114         lu_context_fini(&test_session);
02115 cleanup_env:
02116         lu_env_fini(&env);
02117         RETURN(rc);
02118 }
02119 
02120 static struct obd_ops llog_obd_ops = {
02121         .o_owner       = THIS_MODULE,
02122         .o_setup       = llog_test_setup,
02123         .o_cleanup     = llog_test_cleanup,
02124 };
02125 
02126 static int __init llog_test_init(void)
02127 {
02128         return class_register_type(&llog_obd_ops, NULL, true, NULL,
02129                                    "llog_test", NULL);
02130 }
02131 
02132 static void __exit llog_test_exit(void)
02133 {
02134         class_unregister_type("llog_test");
02135 }
